newsitem.title: USA: U.S. corn weekly export sales highlights--USDA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. corn weekly export sales highlights--USDA.

text.p: USDA corn export sales highlights in latest reporting week:
Net sales of 477,300 MT were 14 percent lower than the previous week and 7 percent less than the 4-week average.

Major increases reported for Taiwan (164,700 MT), Japan (67,200 MT), Egypt (58,600 MT), Venezuela (45,100 MT), and Turkey (33,800 MT) were partially offset by decreases for unknown destinations (54,100 MT).
Net sales activity of 395,400 MT for delivery in 1997/98 were primarily for unknown destinations (153,000 MT), Japan (127,000 MT), and Syria (50,000 MT).

Exports of 639,000 MT were 8 percent above the week earlier, but 3 percent less than the 4-week average. The principal recipients were Japan (199,700 MT), Egypt (58,600 MT), Taiwan (56,700 MT), Saudi Arabia (55,000 MT), Mexico (52,200 MT), and El Salvador (43,000 MT).
